content.description: Starts in a scooping dihedral and makes a few akward moves up, then traverse left on the crack to the jugs.  The crux is getting around the arete.  After you reach the jugs shake out, chalk up and climb up.  It's easy but high.
content.protection: Pads, spotters and words of encouragement for the top out
content.location: Just after you cross the bridge leaving the parking lot, take the trail on your right.  Take about 10 steps and look to the left, you can't miss it.

content.description:
The drink, not a bouldering grade. 

  A tricky crack that actually climbs quite well with the right beta.  Squat start at the lip of the roof with a two handed jug in the crack.  Follow a jug and a sidepull up the crack to the crux and figure out how to stand up on the face. 

  A much more difficult variation starts 10-15 feet down in the lowball cave and climbs into the start. 

  Smoothie links Lactose into this climb as a worthy moderate.
content.location: On the backside of the Welcome Boulders, away from the trail.  Scramble left to downclimb the slab, or head right to drop down to another boulder.

content.description: A slopey traverse that nearly becomes a highball at the end.  Sit start at the base of the boulder on the right side of the face.  The holds are usually buried under pine needles and leaves.  Pull up to the arete/lip out left and move around the corner to follow the lip up and left before mantling over and finishing.
content.location: On the backside of the Welcome Boulders, away from the trail.  This arete is on the opposite side of the boulder from Smoothie & Lactose.

content.description: An uninspiring and crumbling face.  Stand start the right end of the face by the arete and head up with large although questionable holds.
content.location: In the corridor between the two Welcome Boulders, this problem climbs the face/arete behind the start of Utter Arete.  To get down, walk left and scramble.

content.description: A long, fun problem with some great beta.  This line moves left to right up the overhanging side of the boulder and links Lactose into V-8.  Sit start with hands in the small slots formed by the crack and left foot on a good block.  Move right hand to the good jug, get a kneebar, and cross left hand up to a quartz crimp.  Change the kneebar to a heelhook and slap a sloper on the lip before bumping into the crack (crux).  Another heelhook will help the transition into the better holds.  Finish up the crack.
content.location: The Welcome Boulders are the first two boulders across the bridge from the parking lot.  This problem is on the backside of the second boulder.

content.description: A very short beginner problem or something to warm up on.  Sit start the short ass end of the boulder before the "cave" feature, left of Lactose with good slopey holds.  Pull off the ground and reach up for the top of the boulder before topping out.  Named after a crystal on the rock that sliced open a finger or two before breaking.
content.location: On the Welcome Boulders, this climb is the first you see as you approach from the Welcome Crack & North Face.  Downclimb the short slab on the left.

content.description: Another great warmup or beginner problem that starts beneath the left side of the overhang right of Lactose. Sit start with a good right-hand jug and either a left heel hook or a high right foot in the cave.  Power up to the same crystally jug as on Lactose and finish straight up.  Try not to get your fingers stuck in the start hold.
content.location: On the backside of the Welcome Boulders, away from the trail. Easily downclimb a short slab off left.

content.description: Even with the 1-minute approach, this highball doesn't see much love.  Sit start as for the Welcome Crack with a sidepull and a right arete and pull up into crimps & sidepulls before standing tall on an undercling and reaching around a small roof to better holds.  Finish straight up.
content.location: On the Welcome Boulders, this climbs the face that faces the trail.  Scramble off right from the top.

content.description: A fun, albeit short climb that is usually worth cleaning the pine needles and spider webs off of.  Right of Smoothie and V-8, locate the short crack and arete atop the short boulders.  Wedge a pad or two on top so you don't fall through the hole.  Sit start with a left hand in the crack and right hand on the arete.  Pull up and slap up the crack until you can reach over the lip to better holds.  Topout and rejoice in the obscurity.
content.location: On the backside of the Welcome Boulders, away from the trail, roughly a 1-minute approach.  Walk left and drop down onto the lower boulder to get down.

content.description: Sit start with the small rock in between your legs. Grab the sidepull jug and undercling it with both hands. Choose your feet wisely and make a couple of hard moves straight up following the crack. Stick the good hold and finish up and right on slopers in the crack.
content.protection: The landing is a bit funky. When doing the sit start you will most likely want to stack a pad to prevent you from sliding down into the cave. There is also a funky rock under neath the slab topout.
content.location: The backside of the Welcome Boulders.

content.description: A great warmup or beginner problem that starts beneath the left side of the overhang.  Sit start with two good fingerslots in the crack and use a large left foot.  Pull up to a crimp or power straight up to a crystally jug.  Work straight up on good holds and then repeat.
content.location: On the backside of the Welcome Boulders, away from the trail.  Easily downclimb a short slab off left.

content.description: Although not usually clean due to lack of traffic, this problem is better than its neighbor.  Stand start the low angle face on the right of the arete and climb straight up to a semi-highball topout.
content.location: When approaching the Welcome Boulders from the trail, this problem will be around the left side, on the rear of the first boulder, to the right of Tequila Sunrise.

content.description: The first two boulders you'll encounter just after crossing the ailing bridge from the parking lot.  A few high classics are interspersed with some steep entry level problems and a project out the cave.  Don't miss the Welcome Crack or Smoothie.
